title.value: Структурно-функциональная характеристика нервного аппарата двенадцатиперстной кишки поросят в постнатальном онтогенезе
The structural and functional characteristic of the duodenum nervous system of pigs in postnatal ontogenesis
The structural and functional characteristic of the duodenum nervous system of pigs in postnatal ontogenesis

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Skudnaya, T.M., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented the results of studies of morphological researches of pigs' duodenum of 1, 15, 30, 45 and 60-day age. The most heterogeneous sizes of synaptic vesicles are revealed in the age of 15-45 days. Hence, high vulnerability intramural nervous system in first ten days after a birth speaks by complex system 'aplasia' of interneural and neural fibers relations. In the early postnatal ontogenesis of intramural nervous system of the duodenum of pigs contains a significant percentage of neuroblasts which differentiation occurs more intensively from 15 up to 45-day's age. During this period, neurons have a high plasticity and intramural nervous system of duodenum is capable to reconstruct the activity under influence of alimentary factors and medicamentous means, which should be considered in growing pigs.
